Important Continous Distributions

There are a number of continuous distributions which have important applications in engineering and science. The areas of application and a little of the history (where appropriate) of the more important and useful distributions will be discussed in the later quizzes. Among the most important continuous probability distributions are the following.

  1. The Uniform or Rectangular distribution, where the random variable \(X\) is restricted to a finite interval \([a, b]\) and \(f(x)\) has constant density often defined by a function of the form: \[ f(x) = \begin{cases} \dfrac{1}{b-a} & \text{for all $ a \leq  x \leq b$} \\ \\ 0 & \text{elsewhere} \end{cases}. \]
  2. The Exponential distribution defined by a probability density function of the form: \[ f(t)= \lambda e ^{-\lambda t},\] \(\lambda\) is a given constant.
  3. The Normal distribution (often called the Gaussian distribution) where the random variable \(X\) is defined by a probability density function of the form: \[f(x) = \dfrac{1}{\sigma \sqrt{2\pi}} e^{-(x-\mu)^2/2\sigma^2},\] \(\sigma, \mu\) are given constants.
  4. The Weibull distribution where the random variable \(X\) is defined by a probability density function of the form: \[f(x)=\alpha \beta (\alpha x)^{\beta-1}e^{-(\alpha x)^{\beta}},\] \(\alpha, \beta\) are given constants.
